topic: English - G9 | Quarter 1 - Module 1: Modal Verbs

definitions.title: Understanding Modal Verbs
definitions.definition: Modal verbs are helping verbs that show the mood or attitude of the speaker. They express ability, necessity, obligation, or permission.
definitions.example: Examples: must, should, can, may, ought to, have to
definitions.explanation: They modify the main verb to express how certain, possible, or necessary an action is.

definitions.title: Using 'Must'
definitions.definition: ‘Must’ is used to express strong obligation or necessity.
definitions.example: Example: You must complete your homework before playing.
definitions.explanation: It means something is required or very important.

definitions.title: Using 'Should'
definitions.definition: ‘Should’ expresses advice, recommendation, or something expected.
definitions.example: Example: You should study for your exams.
definitions.explanation: It’s used when something is the right or wise thing to do, but not compulsory.

definitions.title: Using 'Ought To'
definitions.definition: ‘Ought to’ has a similar meaning to ‘should’. It expresses moral duty or correctness.
definitions.example: Example: You ought to respect your parents.
definitions.explanation: It is often used when giving advice or stating what is morally right.

definitions.title: Using 'Have To'
definitions.definition: ‘Have to’ shows obligation or necessity that comes from outside forces or rules.
definitions.example: Example: You have to wear your uniform to school.
definitions.explanation: It means there’s an external rule or situation requiring you to do something.

definitions.title: Using 'Need To'
definitions.example: Example: You need to eat healthy food.
definitions.explanation: It’s used when something is essential for a goal or result.

definitions.title: Using 'Had To'
definitions.definition: ‘Had to’ is the past form of ‘have to’, expressing past obligation or necessity.
definitions.example: Example: I had to finish my project last night.
definitions.explanation: It means something was required or necessary in the past.

definitions.title: Practice: Modal Verbs in Context
definitions.definition: Let’s apply what you learned! Choose the correct modal verb to complete each sentence.
definitions.example: Example: You ____ follow the teacher’s instructions carefully.
definitions.explanation: Choices: A. must  B. should  C. ought to  D. have to
